headline: A Look at DaVita’s Valuation Following New $3.5 Billion Credit Agreement
summary: DaVita (DVA) just finalized an amended credit agreement that brings in a $2 billion five-year term loan and a $1.5 billion revolving credit facility. This refinancing not only repays previous debt, but also offers additional financial flexibility for corporate needs. See our latest analysis for DaVita. DaVita’s recent credit agreement comes as the stock has struggled to regain its footing, with a year-to-date share price decline of 20.1% and a 12-month total shareholder return of -28%. While...
